name: Hitler And His Thugs Trivia Quiz | German | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote 'The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich'?
questions.explanation:
William L. Shirer

	All wrote books. Speer wrote 'Inside the Third Reich'; Churchill wrote extensively about the war. Trevor-Roper was a prominent historian. Shirer's book is particularly well known in the U.S.

questions.text: As a young man, what did Hitler want to become?
questions.explanation:
artist.

	He was a failed artist.

questions.text: Where was Hitler when he wrote 'Mein Kampf'?
options: Recovering in a hospital from WW I wounds
At the battlefields of WW I
questions.explanation:
In prison.

	He was in prison following his failed attempt to seize power in November 1923 in the Munich 'Beer Hall putsch'.

questions.text: Who was the head of the SS?
questions.explanation:
Himmler.

	Heinrich Himmler was head of the SS from 1929 to 1945.

questions.text: The best known attempt to assassinate Hitler during WW II occurred via ...?
questions.explanation:
A concealed bomb.

	A bomb was concealed in a briefcase. It exploded - but (unfortunately) didn't get the job done.

questions.text: Which German soldier and hero was implicated in the plot to assassinate Hitler?
questions.explanation:
Rommel.

	It was a turning point in Rommel's life. He subsequently committed suicide.

questions.text: Which of these Nazis committed suicide just hours before his scheduled execution at Nuremberg?
Who was the so-called 'Angel of Death'?
questions.explanation:
Mengele.

	Rohm and Strasser were prominent in the early days of the party; Eva Braun was Hitler's mistress.

questions.text: Which of these Nazis took off on a wild airplane ride in an apparent effort to negotiate a peace in May 1941?
Rudolf Hess was sentenced to life imprisonment by the Nuremberg Tribunal. Where did he serve his sentence?
questions.explanation:
Spandau.

	He stayed there alone for a long time until his death.
